intro: Pilosella collina subsp. granensis, commonly known as the granitic pilosella, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Argentina and Chile. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils, often in mountainous or coastal areas. It has a low-growing habit with a basal rosette of leaves and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Its botanical features make it well adapted to harsh environmental conditions.
